quest.name: Of Wolves and Gentlemen
journal: Shigure is chiding himself for overlooking the obvious answer.

Even if the Wolf Burglar managed to pass through the Ruby Price unnoticed, he will have had to contend with the Confederacy, which has a vested interest in forcing all who traverse their waters to pay the tithe. Sakazuki is the first stop for most travelers who do not wish to risk the ire of the pirates, so it is the ideal place to continue your search.

A suspicious individual in a skiff was spotted not long ago, it seems, but the pirate who spied him was reluctant to stop him on account of the stranger being bereft of life. Dead, deceased. An ex-man, as it were. Not one to consort with the undead, the pirate took what he deemed was the only reasonable course of action and looked the other way. But you, on the other hand...

Shigure scoffs at the pirate's account, but his disdain soon turns to delight as he concludes that the corpse was in fact The Eoruzean Gentleman, and the skiff was that of the Wolf Burglar. Their destination appeared to be the Isle of Bekko, and so it is now yours.

In a twist that you really ought to have seen coming, the dead man who was sighted aboard the small skiff really was in fact a dead man─A Gentle Dead Man, to be precise. Having heard rumors of a contingent of fellow undead on a certain island in the Sirensong Sea, he embarked on a grand journey...only to find at his destination the various skeletons wholly devoid of unlife, owing to your prior intervention. After gently chiding you for your propensity for violence against the undead, he further explains that he continued on to the Far East after sensing the presence of Master Zombibrand, for whom he is still searching. Oh, and somewhere along the way he acquired some werewolf attire, because life is funny like that.

With the aid of the Gentle Dead Man, you finally catch up to the Wolf Burglar, as he flees across the Isle of Bekko with a still-frozen Inspector Hildibrand on his back. Resolving once more to restore her mentor to the land of the moving, Nashu draws forth a set of her infamous Delights and heaves them into the inspector's waiting arms. The resulting explosion leaves the awakened Hildibrand and the annoyed Wolf Burglar clinging to opposite sides of a rocky bridge, the ground far below promising a swift and painful death. Nashu assures you, however, that the inspector will surely survive the fall, having lived through the rather more harrowing experience of returning to the star from the false moon, Dalamud. And so you all prepare to seize the Wolf Burglar and bring him to justice at last, only to watch helplessly as he escapes astride a giant bird of prey that swoops in at the last moment to catch him, in yet another twist that you really ought to have seen coming. Shortly thereafter, Inspector Hildibrand rejoins you atop the cliffs, albeit for only an instant, as his keen inspector's sense alerts him to a petitioner in need not far away.

You find Inspector Hildibrand conversing with a wayward Qiqirn, who claims to be a sailor on a ship belonging to the East Aldenard Trading Company. It would seem that he and his fellow Qiqirn were lured by promises of delicious foodstuffs into a dark alley, where they were set upon by men who bound and gagged his friend. Though he himself managed to escape by jumping into the sea, the current carried him to the island, and he knows not what became of his comrade─but you do. Indeed, in all likelihood he is the Qiqirn you saw at the auction─the selfsame auction where Inspector Hildibrand was nearly sold as a statue. Perhaps the silver-tongued broker who organized the auction is not all that he seems...

The broker is flustered by the sight of the inspector living and breathing, but regains his composure when Shigure attempts to detain him for his many crimes, countering that the samurai has no right to do so. Indeed, he does not, for Shigure is no more than a common ronin with no ties to the Sekiseigumi─a ronin whom the broker hired to guard the auction which was robbed by the Wolf Burglar. Though Inspector Hildibrand reiterates that the broker's crimes are impossible to deny, it seems he will escape justice...until a man of the Sekiseigumi steps forward and asserts his own authority, placing the broker under arrest. The samurai thanks Shigure for his efforts, only to then chastise him for his recklessness, stating that he still cannot in good conscience permit him to join their ranks. After the samurai and the others depart, Shigure confesses how he came to Kugane to pursue his dream of joining the Sekiseigumi, only to fail and struggle to make ends meet. By bringing the Wolf Burglar to justice, he hopes to convince the Sekiseigumi to reconsider their decision. This simple, earnest desire is apparently enough to win over Inspector Hildibrand, who declares then and there his intention to help Shigure capture the Wolf Burglar, before dashing off to kami know where with his characteristic gusto.

Though Shigure is grateful for Inspector Hildibrand's promise of assistance, he suspects he may come to rely more upon you in the future. The Wolf Burglar is no common criminal and is possessed of great cunning and cleverness, and sheer passion and determination will surely not suffice to catch him. But if passion is what it will take to win the day, you can count on The Eoruzean Gentleman to deliver!
objectives: Search the Isle of Bekko for the Wolf Burglar.
Speak with the Gentle Dead Man.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: That there tower just keeps on going and going and going...

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Oh, how silly of me. The Confederacy has every reason to note the comings and goings of even the smallest vessels in the Ruby Sea.

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Their very survival rests on their ability to extract payments for safe passage─the so-called Ruby Tithe.

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Sakazuki is where we must go. Any traveler who does not wish to be raided and relieved of their possessions must journey there first and make the necessary overtures...

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: By the kami... I am no wealthy merchant! Be reasonable, I beg of you!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: If you squint just the right way, it looks like it's got ears! Or is it horns...?

dialogue.name: IHAKI
dialogue.text: Searching for a bandit on a boat, you say? As far as I am concerned, the only bandits are those who refuse to pay the tithe─like that one fellow I spotted not long ago.

dialogue.name: IHAKI
dialogue.text: Why didn't I stop him, you ask? Because he was dead! Aye, standing motionless in his skiff, paying no heed to the waves or the waters. A dead man drifting!

dialogue.name: IHAKI
dialogue.text: It is one thing to threaten a living man, but what could I possibly do to stop a dead one? Nothing, that is what! So I took the only reasonable course of action: I let him be!

dialogue.name: IHAKI
dialogue.text: I am not one to consort with the dead, but if you are, by all means, follow the man to the Isle of Bekko. I will remain here and do my best to forget what I saw.

dialogue.name: IHAKI
dialogue.text: I know an ill omen when I see one, and that dead man in a boat was as ill an omen as can be!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: A dead man in a boat bound for the Isle of Bekko? That's the stupidest thing I ever─ Unless... Ah hah! Don't you see? He mistook The Eoruzean Gentleman for a corpse! That boat belonged to none other than the Kugane Wolf Burglar!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Cor, what luck!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Our liaison did mention that we could pay the tithe by way of bringing a trespasser to justice, and I do believe this qualifies!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: The hunt is on! To the Isle of Bekko, and that thrice-damned wolf!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Hark! Over there, a wolf! Or at least someone what's got big ears and a long fluffy tail!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Ah hah! We've got him now!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: So! It seems the Wolf Burglar was caught by the very people that were trying to catch him!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Kami forfend! This is no Wolf Burglar! This is a man dead who yet moves! A restless spirit bound to this mortal coil by burdens of the soul!?

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA
dialogue.text: I beg your pardon, good sir, but my soul carries no such burdens. Indeed, in death I found rather more liberation than I had in life. More purpose and meaning. And brotherhood!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Wait a minute! You're one of the Gentle Dead Men! But what are you doing so far from Eorzea and the others?

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA
dialogue.text: As I live and breathe! In even further reaches I find myself reunited with Master Zombibrand's compatriots! I too must confess some curiosity as to how you came to this place, but since you asked first...

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA
dialogue.text: As unbelievable as it may sound, we heard rumors of an island deep in the Sirensong Sea said to be home to a host of undead individuals not unlike myself. Ours being a rather lonely existence, we resolved to dispatch an emissary to the isle─myself being the logical choice once again...

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA
dialogue.text: Ah... Truly? Well, that would explain why the myriad skeletons we found were devoid of unlife, as it were. That said, even if they were as disagreeable a lot as you claim, I should thank you to stop killing every last undead you encounter in your travels...

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA
dialogue.text: Anyway, having failed in my mission, I was at a loss for what to do next. The island was abandoned, and Eorzea was ever so far away...

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA
dialogue.text: Just then, I felt it─a familiar tingling in my rotting flesh. Aye, there was no denying it: I had felt the pull of our leader, Master Zombibrand! His aether called to me, and I was duty-bound to answer! So I followed the trail and it led me to this place!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Cor, then it's no coincidence! The inspector and the burglar that stole him must be somewhere here on this island!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Good sir, do you still feel Inspector Hildibrand calling to you even now? Can you lead us to him?

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA
dialogue.text: As surely as I can crack open a hapless merchant's head and feast on the goo inside before you can say go! Follow me!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: By the way, I've been meaning to ask. What's with the wolfish getup? It's not the sort of thing a Gentle Dead Man usually wears─though it's quite fetching, I've got to say!

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA
dialogue.text: It warms my dead heart to hear you say so! I received it as a gift from a traveling artist. When I explained to him how difficult it was to converse with the common man, he fashioned it for me, believing it would serve to soften my otherwise terrifying features. And so it has!

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA
dialogue.text: But enough talk─Master Zombibrand needs us!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: ...Nothing I have heard makes even the slightest bit of sense to me. But no matter! If this misshapen undead wolfman can lead us to the thief, I shall trust in him wholly!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Are all the undead in the West so...gentlemanly?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: I think it's a wonderful look for him, don't you?

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA
dialogue.text: Yes, yes! Master Zombibrand is close! We are nearly upon him!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: And the Wolf Burglar! At long last, we will bring that bastard to justice!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Wolf Burglar! You have nowhere left to run! Surrender!

dialogue.name: KUGANEWOLFBURGLAR
dialogue.text: Gah! So they've finally caught up to me!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Cor! He looks exactly like my sketch!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Your campaign of thievery comes to an end this day! Aye, this day the bakufu will have their man! Err...that is to say, their Lupin!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Stop, damn you!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: The inspector's still not snapped out of it, which means it's time for a triple serving of Nashu's Delight─dango style!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: BOOOOOOOOOMBS!

dialogue.name: KUGANEWOLFBURGLAR
dialogue.text: Shut up, you stupid statue!

dialogue.name: KUGANEWOLFBURGLAR
dialogue.text: Bugger me, are those bombs!?

dialogue.name: KUGANEWOLFBURGLAR
dialogue.text: Idiot! Get rid of them! Get rid of them before you kill us both!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Heeeeeelp! Forename! Nashu! Anyone!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I suppose we ought to save the inspector...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Forget Hildibrand! Now's our chance to catch the Wolf Burglar!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Don't worry about the inspector! He survived a trip back from Dalamud, so this is nothing! Let's get that Wolf Burglar instead!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: I told you before, Wolf Burglar─you have nowhere left to run. Fall, on the other hand...

dialogue.name: KUGANEWOLFBURGLAR
dialogue.text: Hmmm... If that's how it's gonna be, then fall it is!

dialogue.name: KUGANEWOLFBURGLAR
dialogue.text: Never thought I'd come this close to getting caught. S'pose it's my own fault for trying to nick a hefty prize like a statue...

dialogue.name: KUGANEWOLFBURGLAR
dialogue.text: But if the statue ain't even a statue, then there's no reason for me to stick around, is there? Better luck next time, thief-takers!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Gah! The nerve of that villain!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I say, Forename...I have come to expect such cold, calculating behavior from dear Nashu, but not you!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Hooray! Inspector Hildibrand is back! Nothing like a brush with certain death to get you back in the game, am I right, Inspector?

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: What manner of sorcery is this? The Eoruzean Gentleman─this statue stands before me, speaking and gesticulating as if a living, breathing being...

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA
dialogue.text: I trust I needn't remind you I too am capable of such motions despite neither living nor breathing, but more to the point, Master Zombibrand is no statue.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Quite right! He's an agent of enquiry! Inspector extraordinaire!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Good sir, by your garb I gather you are a samurai? Am I then correct in assuming we are in the Far East?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Ohohoho! As I wake from gentle slumber and find myself in a foreign land, who should I be greeted by but...a Far Eastern fan?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: But ho, what is this? Already my keen investigator's sense has alerted me to the presence of a petitioner in need.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I must away! For honor and justice and a hard-boiled egg!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Wait for me, Inspector! You know I can't run that fast!

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA
dialogue.text: Master Zombibrand looks to be his old self again. Wonderful, simply wonderful... It is enough to bring a tear to this Gentle Dead Man's eye. Or it would be, if I weren't...you know.

dialogue.name: ZOMBIEA
dialogue.text: But much as I would love to join you in your adventures, I must return to my brothers. I pray you watch over and keep our undead overlord safe!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: So...in Eorzea, a man may be an inspector extraordinaire as well as a zombie overlord? Truly, yours is a land of many mysteries and strange customs I daresay I will never comprehend.

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: While I regret that we were unable to apprehend the Wolf Burglar, I am glad that this chase has seen you reunited with your comrade. Come, let us follow him and see where his “keen sense” leads.

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Another ratman? Like the one they sold at the auction?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Looks like Inspector Hildibrand found a Qiqirn!

dialogue.name: QIQIRN03021
dialogue.text: Friend in need of friend. Are you friend?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Did I not tell you I had caught the scent of a case? And here it is! I give you, “The Case of the Kidnapped Qiqirn”!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Simply put, this adorable little fellow's dearest friend was abducted by a dastardly fellow in the nearby city of Kugane.

dialogue.name: QIQIRN03021
dialogue.text: We sail on ships as sailors! For East Aldenard Trading Company! Docked at Kugane docks to unload goodly goods, when goodly merchant comes and offers tasty feast to me and friendly friend!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: By the kami, did that ratman just speak!?

dialogue.name: QIQIRN03021
dialogue.text: Qiqirn, not ratman, rude man! Why does no one here know Qiqirn? Always demon, demon, with lucky flesh. Hmph...

dialogue.name: QIQIRN03021
dialogue.text: We go with goodly merchant. All alone. Many turns, left right left, very confusing. Then bad men grab friendly friend! Put gag in mouth and bag on head! I fight back and run, and they run too, and then I jump into water!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: It would seem that the currents carried him to the shores of this island. But I have yet to ascertain the motive for why anyone would want to kidnap a hapless Qiqirn sailor...

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: ...Because they do not know or do not care that he is a Qiqirn. He passes for a ratman of Far Eastern folklore─the flesh of which some believe bestows everlasting life...

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: An Eorzean sailor with most unusual features. An incredible albeit hideous statue of Eorzean make that was in truth a man. I daresay we have already met our goodly merchant.

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: We must return to Kugane and confront this criminal at once! He may have abducted others from faraway lands to sell at auction. The fiend!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: At the very least, we know he sold this Qiqirn's friendly friend. We've got to save him too!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Right you are, my lady. We shall see the wicked punished and the innocent set free!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Yes... Yes! I was just about to say that! Well said, you!

dialogue.name: TRADER03020
dialogue.text: Kami strike me down! The Eoruzean Gentleman is alive!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Hearken to me, merchant! Your reckoning is at hand!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: For the crime of kidnapping a Qiqirn sailor and selling him into slavery, I hereby place you under arrest!

dialogue.name: TRADER03020
dialogue.text: Huh? I should hope I would remember doing something so reprehensible as that...

dialogue.name: TRADER03020
dialogue.text: But more importantly, who are you to level such accusations, much less place me under arrest? You're not of the Sekiseigumi─a common ronin, are you not?

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: You...

dialogue.name: TRADER03020
dialogue.text: A common ronin come from the countryside looking for work─work I so generously provided when I hired you to guard my auction. An auction you failed to defend against a thief who stole a priceless piece!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I say, what audacity! That selfsame “piece” stands before you, with the Qiqirn who escaped your kidnapping attempt, as incontrovertible proof of your misdeeds!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I, Hildibrand, agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire, have defeated you! The least you could do is demonstrate dignity in defeat! The truth is plain─there is no denying it!

dialogue.name: TRADER03020
dialogue.text: ...And yet, I do. “Inspector,” was it? Whatever authority you may possess in Eorzea is not recognized here. Only the Sekiseigumi can compel answers and arrest criminals.

dialogue.name: TRADER03020
dialogue.text: And with that, I bid you good day...

dialogue.name: DIGNIFIEDSEKISEIGUMI
dialogue.text: (-???-)You need not answer to them, but you will answer to me...

dialogue.name: DIGNIFIEDSEKISEIGUMI
dialogue.text: We've had our eye on you for some time, my friend. But alas, all good things must come to an end...

dialogue.name: DIGNIFIEDSEKISEIGUMI
dialogue.text: The Wolf Burglar's meddling merely delayed the inevitable. We have all the proof we need. Now, do yourself a favor and come quietly. Or don't, and do me a favor...

dialogue.name: DIGNIFIEDSEKISEIGUMI
dialogue.text: Shigure. Owing to the efforts of you and yours, we can finally bring this charlatan to justice. For that, you have my deepest thanks.

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Th-Thank you, sir! That you would favor me with such kind words is a great honor! I can only hope that this goes some way towards─

dialogue.name: DIGNIFIEDSEKISEIGUMI
dialogue.text: However! That you failed to inform the Sekiseigumi of the Wolf Burglar's crime, despite being present, and instead pursued the thief on your own is inexcusable!

dialogue.name: DIGNIFIEDSEKISEIGUMI
dialogue.text: I cannot in good conscience admit you to the Sekiseigumi at this time. Such reckless disregard and thirst for personal glory are traits I will not suffer in our samurai.

dialogue.name: QIQIRN03021
dialogue.text: A thousand thanks to you for saving friendly friend! Warier and warier we will be next time─no more following goodly merchants into dark alleys!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: I owe you all an apology. Like the merchant said, I am no more than a common ronin. My pursuit of the Wolf Burglar has been, from the very beginning, independent of the Sekiseigumi or any other authority.

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: I came to Kugane to join the Sekiseigumi, but was judged to be unworthy. Unable to find gainful employment as a samurai elsewhere, I struggled to make ends meet...

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: And then, when I was about to renounce my dream and return to my village, I learned of a notorious thief. A thief that targeted only the most wealthy and influential. A thief that I might bring to justice and thereby earn the approval of the Sekiseigumi...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Say no more, my good samurai! Your earnest nature and passion for the law have won me over!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I swear to you, here and now: I, Hildibrand, agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire, shall help you scour all creation─

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: From the deepest pit of the seven hells to the very pinnacle of the heavens─for the Kugane Wolf Burglar! And we shall start right this instant!

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: I'm...I am still not quite sure what to make of that man, but I suppose I should be grateful for the help...

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Forename, was it? I should thank you for joining me in this endeavor, perhaps more so than the others. Their help is of questionable benefit, whereas yours seems rather more reliable.

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: The Wolf Burglar is not to be underestimated. He is a cunning, clever foe, as evidenced by the way he escaped. Sheer passion and determination will not be enough to catch him.

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: Which is to say that while I value the assistance of the inspector and his assistant, I believe cooler heads will prevail in the end. To wit, yours and mine.

dialogue.name: SHIGURE
dialogue.text: I too may be prone to fits of passion, but I should like to think it is nothing compared to that of The Eoruzean Gentleman!

obj.n: In the Eye of the Hingan
